LanguageData.RitualDevelopmentPointRewards: The following development points will be awarded depending on the ritual outcome
LanguageData.ChooseStructureMemesInfo: Choose the symbolic structure of your ideoligion. This only affects symbols - it does not affect gameplay.
LanguageData.ChooseNormalMemesInfo: Choose {0}-{1} memes to form the foundational ideas of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.SomeMemesHaveMoreImpact: Some of these have much more gameplay impact than others.
LanguageData.ChooseNormalMemesFluidIdeoInfo: Choose one meme to form the initial idea of this ideoligion. You will add more memes as the ideoligion develops over time.
LanguageData.ChooseOrRemoveMeme: Choose a meme or remove a meme.
LanguageData.ChangesRandomizePrecepts: {0} will re-randomize any precepts you have edited.\n\nDo you wish to continue?
LanguageData.ConfirmChangeMemesForFluidIdeo: The ideoligion you are loading has memes that are incompatible with a new fluid ideoligion and its memes will need to be chosen again (fluid ideoligions may only start with one low-impact meme).
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssign: You're about to assign the role of {ROLE_labelDef} to {PAWN_labelShort}.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignReplace: {PAWN_labelShort} currently holds this role and will be unhappy to lose it.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignHasOtherRole: {PAWN_labelShort} currently holds the role of {ROLE_label} and will be unhappy to lose it.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmAssignReplaceLeader: There can be only one leader. This will dismiss {PAWN_labelShort} from their {OTHERROLE_labelDef} role, which will make {PAWN_objective} upset.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleConfirmUnassign: You're about to dismiss {PAWN_labelShort} from the role of {ROLE_labelIndef}. This will upset {PAWN_objective}.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleListApparelDemands: The {ROLE_label} role requires the following apparel
LanguageData.ChooseRoleListWorkTypeRestrictions: {PAWN_labelShort} will refuse to do these work types
LanguageData.ChooseRoleHint: It can sometimes be better to wait until your colony is more established before you assign roles.
LanguageData.ChooseRoleRequiredWorkTagsDisabled: WARNING: {PAWN_nameDef} is unable to do work that is required for the role of {ROLE_label}. If you choose to give {PAWN_objective} this role, {PAWN_pronoun} may be unable to use the abilities associated with {ROLE_label}. The missing work types are
LanguageData.CannotNotAddRoleApparelDueToMeme: The meme {MEME} prevents adding apparel requirements to roles.
LanguageData.ReformIdeoligionDesc: Reform your ideoligion by changing its structure, memes or style.
LanguageData.ReformIdeoRelicHuntQuestEnd: The relic {0} will not be venerated by your colonists after reforming this ideoligion. Since the quest '{0}' is searching for this relic, it will be deactivated.
LanguageData.ReformIdeoCancelRituals: The ritual {0} is in progress and will be cancelled.
LanguageData.NegotiatorWillNotTradeSlaves: {0_nameDef} refuses to sell people into slavery according to {0_possessive} beliefs.
LanguageData.NegotiatorWillNotTradeSlavesTip: The negotiator, {0_nameDef}, will not people into slavery due to {0_possessive} belief in {1}.\n\nNote that {0_nameDef} is willing to ransom someone back to {0_possessive} own faction, but isn't willing to sell someone to a different faction.
LanguageData.LastHumanMeatDesc: Because of {PAWN_possessive} belief in {IDEO_name}, {PAWN_nameDef} will become unhappy if {PAWN_pronoun} goes more than {DURATION} days without eating human meat.
LanguageData.ExectueNeutralFactionSlave: Executing {PAWN_labelShort} will negatively affect relations with {FACTION_name}.
LanguageData.CaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneNonSlaveColonis: You must assign at least one non-slave colonist who can walk.
LanguageData.SourceCaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneNonSlaveC: You must leave at least non-slave colonist who can walk.
LanguageData.PawnUnhappyWithStyleItems: {PAWN_nameDef} will be unhappy with the following
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescription: Style categories affect the appearance of some buildings, apparel and weapons made by {IDEO_memberNamePlural}. If more than one category affects the same thing, the left-most one applies.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescriptionAbstract: Style categories affect the appearance of some buildings, apparel and weapons made by your colony. If more than one category affects the same thing, the left-most one applies.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescStyleDominance: {IDEO_memberNamePlural} will be happy if they notice buildings, floors, and art matching this style.
LanguageData.StyleCategoryDescStyleDominanceAbstract: Ideoligion members will be happy if they notice buildings, floors, and art matching this style.
LanguageData.HairAndBeardsDesc: These settings determine how frequently each style appears on members of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.TattoosDesc: These settings determines how frequently each tattoo appears on members of this ideoligion.
LanguageData.ResetButtonDesc: Resets all style items to their default values.
LanguageData.ChooseProductionModeInitialDesc: Here you can choose which caste of dryads this {TREE_label} will create.\n\nDryads will emerge from pods that grow at the tree's base. The maximum number of dryads is based on the connection strength between {TREE_definite} and the connected person.
LanguageData.ChooseColonistsForIdeoTitle: Choose who to convert to your ideoligion
LanguageData.ChooseColonistsForIdeoDesc: You may convert people to your primary ideoligion when setting up a new colony.
LanguageData.ChooseThingsForNewColonyDesc: Choose which colonists, animals and relics to bring to the new colony.
LanguageData.ChooseOnlySlavesInfo: If you only select slaves, you will play them as colonists in the next colony.
LanguageData.ShipEscapeWillEndDescription: The hibernating starship reported by the AI (*Name)Charlon Whitestone(/Name) will fly away by the time the new colony is established. It will no longer be possible to escape the planet by traveling to this ship.
LanguageData.ArchonexusRelicNotChosen: No relic was chosen to be brought to the new colony.
LanguageData.ArchonexusItemsNotChosen: {0} out of a possible {1} items were selected to be brought to the new colony.
LanguageData.RemoveEquippedRelicsDescription: The colony's purchasers will only allow you to take one relic. Any other relics will be left behind (even if equipped by a colonist), including:
LanguageData.WantToProceed: Would you like to proceed? Past this point, there's no going back.
LanguageData.AbandonArchotechStructuresWarningDialog: You are abandoning a site that contains archotech structures which you have not yet fully studied.\n\nYou will be able to resettle here later, but your colony will be wiped away.
LanguageData.ItemQuantityTooltip: {0} quantity that can be brought to the new colony.\n\nThe maximum allowed quantity is: {1}
LanguageData.SoldColonyDescription: Your colony was sold. Its purchasers are ready for you to choose where to land next.
LanguageData.ConfirmHackEnenyTerminal: Hacking this {0} will alert enemies and cause them to attack. Do really want to hack {0}?
